intro: Pentacalia ledifolia subsp. lehmannii, commonly known as the Lehmann's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often found in dry, open habitats such as savannas and scrublands. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a desirable plant for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
